text: I went to Home Bistro tonight looking for a good dining experience and was instead met with an incapable server and an egotistical owner. After waiting five minutes to be acknowledged the server came over to the table and said "are you ready?" and things went downhill from there. Asa solo diner i was uncertain if i wanted an appetizer salad and entree or just an app and entree. I wanted to be able to gauge how hungry i was before placing the rest of my order. i understood that this could mean a delay in my order and i expressed that understanding. The server refused to take only part of my order and after considering how rude this was i asked for the owner who also refused to meet my needs as the customer. I ended up leaving without eating a thing. It seems to me that if you arent interested in taking care of your customers and you run a restaurant then you are in the wrong business. Its no wonder the place is nearly empty everytime i walk by.

We're foodies and like to try new restaurants.  This is our favorite.  We go there often, especially after we've had a bad meal elsewhere and want to restore our faith in what a great dining experience should be.  The staff is always attentive--but not intrusive.  The dishes are creative, well-presented and delicious.  And if you get a table by the window, the people watching is never dull.

They sponsored a five course tasting menu for a special event on Monday 8/7/17, and this was the most disappointed I have been in a restaurant in the past 5 years. Reservations are required for this event, so you would think they could manage the crowd, the food, and the service. I've been to HB before and had mediocre meals, but the BYOB keeps me coming back. This bad experience has ensured I will never return to HB. It seems like when things go bad, they go really bad...and there is no attempt to correct the problem or keep customers happy.   The service was inattentive, cold, and not at all concerned with our experience. We were sitting there for 15 minutes with no attention from our server, so I flagged him down so that we could place our orders. I get that they are busy for a special event, but you would think they could staff it appropriately and plan in advance. The server had minimal communication with the table for the entire night.   The first course was an antipasto with whipped salted cod, olive oil, on a piece of bread. It was basically a salty piece of bruschetta, and the whipped cod is not particularly appetizing. Our server dropped a plate of four pieces at the table, made no mention of what the dish was, and immediately raced off. We had to flag him down, ask for four small plates so that we could share the appetizer. The waiter's response: "sure, if we have any." Is it too much to expect a restaurant to have clean dishes to use as sharing plates? We got another copy of the tasting menu because we realized that not every dish would be announced.   Second course was much better. Sausage dish was enjoyed by our friends. I ordered the swordfish crudo, with lemon, pistachio, and Calabrian chili. The flavor profile was nice, and the swordfish was fresh and delicious. This was the bright spot of our night.   Third course was awful. I ordered the tripe alla romana, with pancetta, garlic, san marzano tomatoes, and mint. I had never ordered tripe before, so this was partially my own fault for not asking more questions. Tripe is part of the cow's stomach, so buyer beware. My friend is from London, and told me that tripe is usually served tender and can be quite delicious. However HB's tripe was tough, chewy, and tasted as if it was straight out of a fear factor gross-eating competition. It also smelled like it was cow stomach. Ok, so maybe tripe is not my thing.   I flagged down the waiter, told him that I didn't enjoy the dish and asked if it could be swapped out for another salad instead. His response: "we're running out of food, so there's nothing we can do." A restaurant running out of food...hmmm. When you run out of a special dish or two, they get removed from the menu. When you run out of food, you close the doors for the night. Any other restaurant would have offered you something else, taken it off the bill, whatever. Some sort of gesture to show that they care about your dining experience. Instead the waiter immediately cleared the tripe dish away without asking me if I was finished with it. If I'm stuck with paying for the dish, I would have at least let my friend pick at the pancetta bits.   Fourth course was the entrée, and this was mediocre. I ordered the orecchiette with wild board pancetta, rapini, chili flakes, pecorino. This dish had some much potential, but...my portion came out with 12 noodles, three pieces of broccoli rapini, and 6 pieces of pancetta. The flavor was decent; the portion was miniscule. It was so obviously under-portioned on such a large dinner plate! I didn't even bother complaining at this point, because I know I would get some absurd line about how a restaurant with pre-planned reservations was "running out of food". Resistance is futile, and I think our waiter may have been the manager also. On the way out we saw someone served a plate with at least double the amount of orecchiette.   For the ending, we were served goats milk cheese with honey and figs. And also some cannoli's. They were decent, but small, and at that point we are just looking to get out of here. I was so hungry that we had to stop for fast food on the way home; this was also a first.   Overall, the five course menu was extremely underwhelming. For $50, your money goes much further at other restaurants. You could tell HB was trying to be fancy with their menu, but a lot of the dishes were bland and boring. Perhaps the exotic ingredients were contributing to the cost, but the flavor did nothing to justify the price. Horrible service destroys the experience, regardless of the food. We will not be going back.

Zagat writes: "delicious" and "you can't go wrong."  The person who wrote that didn't order the steak frite.  Just left the place having been served the worst steak I've ever been served. You'd have to like chewing gum to like this piece of garbage.  The potatoes and asparagus were excellent. When i complained to the waiter he said to me and my companion, "Get out of here!"

Delicious BYOB in a hidden storefront in Boystown. Home Bistro has a great menu of American food with a modern twist. I would recommend the Wednesday pri-fixed deals as well as making a reservation.  Need to come try for brunch!

We were so excited to try a restaurant in Boystown with such high reviews (hard to find GOOD food in Boystown).  We did not have reservations but the hostess said she could seat us, as there were no reservations until 7:30pm (this was at 6:10pm and there were only 3 tables occupied).  Immediately after we were seated, I ran across the street to get wine and asked the others at our table to order appetizers.  I returned to find that they did not place the appetizer order, as they didn't allow them to.  The server said that we had to order everything at one time.. very odd, but okay.  We ordered and food came out fairly promptly.  The meal was solid and we were, overall, happy with our food.  Now comes the issue.. It's now 7:23 and we ask for a dessert menu.  The server says (while still walking) that we could not order dessert because they needed the table at 7:30.  I was sure I didn't hear him correctly, but (as stated) he said this while walking away so I asked him to come back over.  I asked again about dessert and he said we could not have dessert as they needed the table for a 7:30 reservation.  Now, I completely understand honoring reservations. However, we ordered with plenty of time to be served AND there were 3 other open tables at the time!  I asked for the hostess, who told me the same thing and handed me our check.  UNBELIEVABLE!!  No matter what, they were focused on having that particular table open at 7:30.  Now, there were 3 other tables open at the time.  Plus, what are the chances that all 4 reservations will show up at exactly 7:30.  And how many times do you check in at a restaurant for your reservation and they tell you it will be just a few minutes before your table is ready.. it happens all the time!  I just cannot understand why (I don't want to say it was race, but I saw no other people of color in there, unlike our mixed party).  We left, leaving VERY upset.   Naturally, I walked back past this place at 7:40.. 15 minutes after we were kicked out.  Guess what.. still 2 tables open!!  Needless to say, they won't take any more money from me.

We came here with a big group and had family style dinner.  Wow.  We had the opportunity to try different dishes. Every one of them were  delicious like a fix menu in a really expensive restaurant. plus is BYOB so we were able to bring our favorite wines.  Must visit.
Wow. This place is amazing. Be prepared to eat a lot but to enjoy everything. Highly recommend!!

My boyfriend and I came here for dinner on a Friday night, we made the reservation that afternoon and they were able to squeeze us in at 6:30. By 7pm, the place was crowded.  We took advantage of the BYOB (with no corking fee!) and our waitress immediately offered to open our bottle, then proceeded to recommend a few dishes on the menu.  The had a "specials" menu where we ordered a fried soft shell crab for our appetizer, as well as the homemade pappardelle pasta for my main course (with chicken pesto). My boyfriend ordered the pork cheek of the normal menu and said it was one of the best dishes he'd ever had. All in all, we had a great time at Home Bistro and will definitely be back!

Decided to eat here the other night after reading the reviews.  Cute little place where you bring in your own alcohol/beverage to have with your meal, as I assume they don't have a license.  The menu looked promising with the edgy menu.   It was just okay.  It's hard to rate a place when some things are great and others not so my ratings are as follows.    Service - 5 stars Price - 4 Stars Food - 3 Stars.  Some of the more eclectic foods deserve 4 stars, but some of the less complicated choices were just average, especially the pasta and Caesar Salad - they were not good at all! Homemade Fettuccini and pancetta sounded so good, but the pasta was extremely pasty and very very Al dente! Very little flavor even with the pancetta.  How can a chef blow pasta?   Caesar about par to the Olive Garden. Dandelion salad was good.  Flap steak and spaetzle was also good.  With that said 3 stars overall isn't too bad if you are careful about what you order.

I had brunch here with friends on Sunday. I wasn't sure what to think of the limited Mother's Day brunch menu, but I was blown away by the soft shell crab sandwich with pimento cheese. Sounds different, but it was so good!! I look forward to my next visit & what surprise they may have in store for me. (Bonus-it's BYOB)

Food was great, service was just ok. Our server was slow to pick up our plates, never offered us the dessert menu, and after 30 minutes of waiting we eventually had to ask for our check. Perhaps if they had three waiters instead of two tending to the small dining room our poor service could have been avoided.

Parties of eight or more be forewarned:  You will be charged a minimum of $45 each (that's $60 total after the required tip and tax), even if you are not very hungry and do not require 3 courses.  A party of 8 can only order 4 appetizers, 4 main courses, and 4 desserts (served family style -- i.e. double portions), so if only one of you wants, say, the chicken, tough luck.  They do forewarn the person making the reservation of this policy, so it is up to that person to notify all the others.  When I inquired as to the reason for this policy, I was honestly told that it is because large parties tend to linger and they cannot turn over the table quickly enough to make a profit (understandable on a busy night).  When I replied that we were there Sunday evening when there were only 4 other people there all evening -- no reply.  The meal was OK but a terrible value under their "policy".  Parties of 8 or more should seek more welcoming dining options.

My friend told me about Home Bistro two years ago, he said it was one his favorite places. Maybe things have changed- it was whatever, I don't plan to go back. Sure, BYOB, which is nice, but with so many choices in Chicago why go somewhere just ok? Kind of pricy too, for a restaurant with paper over each table cloth, that jams parties of 2 against a wall at a super small table.  APPETIZERS: dandelion salad (basic, lacking flavor, basically a bowl of green with a few slices of apple,) artichoke and Edam fritters (the garlic aioli was good but not great,) the assorted bread (why it's called "assorted" I don't know - it's ONE piece of toast, cut up into 4 pieces with some spread and slice apple). ENTREES: paneer (not bad, but not amazing, I do eat Indian food a lot so maybe it was a mistake to order an Indian dish at a non-Indian restaurant. Furthermore, there were 3 pieces of panner cheese...3. Then about 7 pieces of squash cut in the shape of paneer. I was hungry when I left); boyfriend ordered the special which was a burger (pretty good, but the truffle fries lacked seasoning and were cold when we got them.) STAFF: our server was nice, but the hostess was aloof, kind of cold. As the restaurant filled up and the staff was stretched and we waited and waited and waited for our check.
We stumbled onto this restaurant and what a surprise! The dessert (chocolate cracker thing) was fantastic!

We made reservations for a Friday evening and we had a group of six people. The atmosphere and staff was very friendly. HB is a BYOB restaurant. We brought some wine and beer. The waitress opened our wine for us. Our grouped order a variety of dinners from the main menu and a couple of specials of the evening. All the food was amazing!! The chicken sausage and wild rice was to die for. The Mint Creek Pork Burger  was one of the best burgers I have tasted and the spring chicken was melt in your mouth. The desserts are just as good. The Bread Pudding was the best I have had in a long time. I would recommend HB to anyone! Must visit when you are in town!

We were looking for a place to eat before heading to the Tina and Tony's Wedding show. Since Home Bistro was within walking distance, we decided to check it out!  After reading some yelp reviews, I was a little concerned we wouldn't be able to get reservations because the place was small.  However, there were plenty of seats for brunch at 1230pm on a Sunday. We were even able to snag a table by the window with a view. The brunch menu was small but I didn't mind. I prefer a small menu with lots of perfected and flavorful dishes than a large menu of mediocre dishes. Home Bistro did not disappoint. I ordered the Korean hash which was a bowl of marinated bulgogi, egg, potatoes, apples, in a sweet sauce. It was delicious! The meat was nice and tender and the potato hash was crisp on the outside and soft on the inside (just the way I like them)! Service was so friendly and fantastic. I must have had my coffee refilled three times. Its definitely bottomless and they make sure your cup is full here. I can't wait to come back and try the other items on their menu.

We went for a quick bite after shopping in the area for a small amount of time, it's awesome that it's byob! Me and my boyfriend each ordered a different entree, he ordered the bulgogi and also the gnocchi, we also started with the daily bread..The food was delicious, but the gnocchi was just overly salty from the use of the blue cheese, and also on top of that the actual salt...The service was nothing memorable but our glasses at least were kept full of water...for the price point I was expecting a bit more of a portion size as both of our portions were rather small and we both left feeling hungry still...The flavors were there so that's why I give it a four stars...I wouldn't come back but I wouldn't also stop any of my friends from coming as well.
Love this BYOB place in Lakeview. Food is delicious, staff is so nice and efficient. Looking forward to dining here again April 29!!

Today I had Easter brunch there. I can honestly say EVERY meal our table ordered was top notch ..6-stars not 5. Loved the B.O.Y.B. as our table shared two bottles of wine. I would love to eat brunch there again. Parking was still good even with a Cubs game going on.  Service was excellent. Yes some of the time it got a little loud in there with the other tables but our group was having fun and blocked it out. I am posting pictures as the presentation  was beautiful.

Yelp lead us here after a Cubs game. It was still early and we had our choice of seats. Sat by the window and people watched while we ordered our food. This is a BYOB, and luckily we had two bottles that we brought with. We started with shishito peppers which were perfectly blistered and tasty, then bulogi/spatzel, this combination was killer!, I could've eaten another serving. There were four of us and we tried five courses and share them all. Also on the menu we tried the gnocchi, Prince Edward musssels, and finally doughnut holes with caramel sauce. Everything was so tasty, I want to go back and try more items on the menu. Staff is very helpful we had no issues, only a great time.
I love Home Bistro. The food is always delicious, I love that it is BYOB, which makes it much more affordable, and the waitstaff is top notch.

A small group of us had dinner here.  My first impression was very positive - quaint little restaurant with a very friendly greeter/server.  We had a terrific table at the front window, so we had a nice view into the neighborhood. The food was very enjoyable.  As a group, we decided to go with the prix fixe menu - sharing appetizers, salads, and desserts.  This was a great way to experiment.  And, my main course (butternut squash risotto) was very nice. My only (minor) complaint - the service was a bit slow.  The restaurant got busy, and we were talking a lot, so I suspect that contributed. Overall, I enjoyed my experience.  Recommended!
The food is so good I jizz every time I eat here.  I can't help it.  And it's embarrassing leaving with a jizz stain.  But it's still worth it.  Thanks HB.

Hands down my favorite restaurant in Lakeview. I've never ordered anything I haven't loved in over 5 years. Extremely friendly staff. Great for BYOB nights out. Every changing menu keeps things fresh. Love this place!
Very hom-ey. Very friendly staff who were able to get me something tasty and vegetarian. This place is BYOB which is awesome. It is definitely pricey though.

Stopped in for a pre-concert dinner and it was terrific.  Two of us shared a shrimp appetizer that was terrific and the mussels which we asked for without chorizo which was not a problem.  A large serving accompanied by truffle fries.  The fries were fresh, perfectly cooked and plentiful.  Brought a nice bottle of wine and gave the waiter the final glass.  Bill for food and tax was extremely reasonable.  All in all, a winner. Atmosphere and service were both excellent.

It's obvious the chef knows how to cook and is passionate about what he does. These are the types of restaurants I love to go to. That being said, my  entrée, the rainbow trout, had too much going on. I order fish because I a actually like to taste the subtle flavor. All I could taste was the horseradish, egg, pickled cabbage, and a ton of salt. Each component was good on it's own, but I was not a fan of the overall combo. I also had several bones in my fish. But, the quail appetizer was excellent, couldn't get enough of the blue cheese sauce. The salad we had was excellent and unique. The potatas bravas  was just okay.. but maybe because I love the tapas version so much and had a hard time not comparing. The bread pudding was phenomenal! My date had the pork belly special and I had to stop him from licking plate... He said how great is dinner was about 10 times after.

This is 2 1/2 stars.....check it Party of 4, first time visit with reservations on a later dinner Friday night.  Great waitress, super nice, informative and attentive.   Let's begin:  Ordered 3 ok appetizers to share; beets, escargot and fritters. We were underwhelmed with each dish. The beet salad had good quality ingredients intended to compliment each other; baby softly pickled beets, fennel and peanut butter crumble (I think). Good effort yet disappointing in flavor.  Escargot had a rich sauce with stewed m tomatoes.  It was good, snails were cooked great and not chewy.  Cauliflower and cheese fritters were little and fried and served with mayo (aioli). They had inedible strings in the batter. So onto 4 entrees to share between my critics; salmon, chicken sandwich, mussels and oxtail goulash. Initially flavors stimulated taste buds but after digging in and consuming our entrees, taste buds ended up being consumed by sodium.  Prolly course salt or sea salt, but too much salt nonetheless.  Portion control of the servings didn't even hold up against the toss of salt.  Flakey salmon steak was a little great cut cooked through exceptionally, but had a heavy over seasoned crust.  Served atop of fresh black beans, blanched sweet potatoes? (Maybe) and green sofrito.  Chicken sandwich was the bomb served in between pretzel buns with a honey mustard and peanut sauce. Truffle fries accompanied with mayo (aioli) and we couldn't tell they were truffled.  Beer mussels were an epic disappointment lacking sauce and sop.  Loving the richness of oxtail goulash mixed with some kind of little pastas and a dollop of sour cream. There were minimal amounts of oxtail meat which defeated our expectations.  Thank god its byob cuz holy check please. Don't even ask me about dessert. Later.

I'm so happy to have found this (somewhat small) restaurant. We stopped by with some friends for dinner, and the atmosphere was cozy and romantic and the server was very friendly and knowledgeable. No corkage fee for the BYOB, which is always a plus! I tried the gnocchi and it was perfectly done, as chewy as I like it and the date puree balanced the richness of the sauce. My boyfriend tried the salmon, and although I can't say that it was the best salmon I've had, it was definitely above average. This is the perfect place if you're looking for somewhere cozy for an intimate dinner.
Nice local place. BYOB is a plus. Food is creative and very good. Not fancy, but has a cozy character to it.

Had our first date, several dates in between, and our wedding rehearsal dinner at HB.  Can't say enough about how great the service is and the people working there.  The food is always great, the atmosphere is really cozy.  For our wedding rehearsal we had so many options to choose and it was essentially like a 10 course meal.  Everyone raved about it.  BYOB without cork fees is awesome, too.  It will continue to be our special night out spot.

Absolute disaster. I ordered the ricotta gnocchi, which had ingredients listed as part of their special. The dish came and I thought it was dipped in brown sugar because it was so sweet. When I inquired what was making it so sweet, the waiter, a tall blonde bearded man, told me that it was the raisins. Firstly, I hate raisins. Had I known there were raisins, I would have NEVER considered the dish. Secondly, when he saw that I hadn't touched my dish, he didn't ask why I haven't indulged in my seemingly sugar coated entree. Not only this, when I voiced my concerns over not knowing that the raisins were the main component of the dish, giving it its overpowering and overwhelming taste, he said, "Oh that makes sense," and walked away.  Horrible experience. I left the dish as it came and he didn't even offer to accommodate me.

Certainly a gem in lakeview/boystown neighborhood. Very small, quaint restaurant with a rotating menu. The menu wasnt pages long but it had items that even the pickiest of eaters would order, along with speciality items. Everything we had high quality ingredients and was well thought out. Definitely a great date night spot. They are also BYOB.
This is one of our favorite places to eat and a BYOB to boot!  Creative imaginative food that never fails to impress. The truffle fries are the best!
Delicious worldly menu.   The sides are damn delicious- pastas braves, shishito peppers, and artichoke & demo fritters.  Delicious! Great atmosphere and it's BYOB- a winner in Lakeview.

Solid four star. Cozy (perfect for 2-4 people, might be less enjoyable for a bigger group because of small space and general background noise level that would make it difficult to have a conversation across a table with a large group of people), casual vibe with well-prepared food. Added bonus is the lack of corkage fee for BYOB and our friendly server - she wasn't pushy at all and I was in no rush catching up with friends I hadn't seen for a while but one could have been annoyed from slow service if they wanted to quickly eat and leave.  I was starving when I came on Friday evening at 7pm but it turned out my eyes were bigger than my stomach - very generous portions. We tried: Appetizers  -fried artichoke: excellent. deep-fried to golden crispy and I don't even like fried food in general -Smoked butternut squash: I love anything winter squash so I seriously turn yellow in the Fall and Winter from all the buttercup squash I consume, but this dish was a meh. Forgettable. -Baby beets: favorite appetizer! Perfectly cooked golden and red beets with goat cheese  Main dishes: -Amsterdam style mussels: I can eat endless amount of oysters and mussels until my stomach hurts. This was the very first time I left more than 1/3 of mussels ever in my life. Maybe I was already full from appetizers but the flavor just wasn't there and mussels weren't plump at all. Fries with garlic aioli were very good though. -gnocchi with lamb meatball and mustard seeds: excellent dish, hearty but not too heavy. -my friend ordered pork belly (special of the day) and he seemed to like it. I was stuffed up to the ears after the meal!! I'm still curious about escargot, pork cheek and trout but there's always a next time!
Can't say enough good things about this place.  The food and service are always of the highest quality (and BYOB!!!).  Always a good option.

We came here for a 12-person group dinner because it is BYOB, and we were pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food. We did a prix fixe menu where the table picked 3-4 appetizers, entrees, and desserts to share. The sizes were quite generous, but the food was hit or miss. Starting at the beginning, I wouldn't order their potatoes: they literally come only drizzled with mayonnaise and ketchup, as one might expect at a low-scale diner. Moreover, I'd be quite weary when it comes to their salads. The first one we got was so spicy that we had to send it back. At first, I figured the chef must have accidentally used cayenne pepper, and a heavy hand at that, in lieu of regular pepper. Turns out, the chef was "experimenting." They kindly replaced the salad, but the new salad was the saltiest thing I've had in week. I can't explain how salty it was. Imagine a salt mine. Oh look, I explained it. I wish I could help more, but my memory starts to get hazy from the BYOB, so I'll leave it here.

Always great food at this place and what's not to like about a BYOB. The staff is always friendly and hospitable. I would highly recommend the stuffed dates as a starter. They're amazing! They always change up the menu and offer seasonal dishes as well.  Can't say enough great things!!!

This place is amazing. We just left from our anniversary dinner and from the moment we walked in we felt a warm, joyful atmosphere. I picked HB based off of revues online and they do not lie! We both had two dished off the chefs special menu and it was OUT OF THIS WORLD!!!! Everything was seasoned perfectly! The chef got flavors out of things that I could only dream of getting out of my food at home. The bread pudding is also to die for!!!! We will definitely be back and you should make it a stop in your date night rotation!!!!

W-o-w. We had the pleasure of going to HB for our two-year anniversary brunch. As fate would had it, we had the place totally to ourselves (45 minutes before closing time). My girlfriend was excited about the great natural light near the window, which was perfect for photographing the food. (Priorities, right?)  I ordered the Chinese fried chicken hash, which was surprisingly filling and generously portioned with a big, deep bowl. I also sampled the veggie burger, which was house-made. I'm a big meat-eater, but it was honestly very tasty and definitely something even I would enjoy eating. The fries were great, as well.  They brought out several freshly-made caramel-glazed doughnuts with cinnamon sugar out--complimentary--to help us celebrate our anniversary. The doughnuts were fluffy, very fresh, piping hot, and the perfect complement to our meal. I was still salivating over other menu items because they all sounded great. We will 100% be back here and I HIGHLY recommend checking this place out!

It's hard to find a sit down American restaurant with free BYOB. The place is cozy and low lit. It's not a big place so I would recommend making reservations. I was seated and set up right away with my water and wine though I was the only person from our party to arrive very early.  The menu is trendy/unique/upscale without totally breaking the bank. Their entrée menu was recently updated so it was hard to ask for suggestions from the waiter.  4 girls shared 2 appetizers. The artichoke and edam cheese fritters was rather disappointing...it was under salted and flavorless. there wasn't a lot of garlic aioli either. I don't think any of us preferred it. The garlic and escargot was pretty good. it would have been better the portion was a bit bigger for sharing.  I ordered the milk poached haddock. I didn't care too much for the lightly flavored fish itself but I liked all the accompaniments like the hearty latkas. it felt like the dish could have used some tartness to round out the taste. 1 friend got the trout which was quite crisp and tasty when I tired it. the other girls seemed to enjoy the beef heart- this was my 1st time trying it and I found it only slightly chewy but it didn't have any adverse after taste...so I guess that's good.    overall it's probably 3.5. I liked the small intimate setting, the free BYOB policy and there is something for everyone.

Romantic, dim ambience, great service and BYOB. You don't feel rushed at all. The food is hit or miss. I have been a few times and the only thing that stands out was a chili pasta with undercooked noodles. Bad, bad. My husband had the trout, he enjoyed it. The appetizer fritters (artichoke?) were bland. I keep checking the menu for updates as I live nearby and would like to give it a third chance, but it seems like the menu hasn't changed much. Guess I'll have to wait awhile.

Used to love this place and been coming for years.   Service was always excellent, food was fantastic.   But the past couple of times it's just been meh.   Went in last week for my birthday dinner.    I think the server forgot we were there.  Another table seated 15 mins after us placed their order and had their food before we even placed our order.    Ok.   It's a busy Friday.    I get it.   But she just seemed like she was doing a job.   Checking us off her list.    Anyway,  ordered the salmon which has always been great.  It came back over cooked - crispy.   And was about as thick as my pinky.   The sides were refrigerated and cold.    For $26 I was incredibly underwhelmed.     When the server finally did decide to visit our table, I asked if the salmon was supposed to be a half inch thick crispy biscuit.   she looked at it and said that it was the end of the fish so it was supposed to be that way.    Seemed pretty lame to me.    In fairness she did ask if I wanted something else but I'm not one to fuss so I said no it's okay.   She trotted off after like she had just checked off that box.     My fiancé got the white bean burger, which was just okay.   We just felt like we were put through the motions and that they didn't care at all if we had a nice experience.   The other server, I think he might be an owner, is great.    I think maybe they got a new chef recently and I've definitely noticed a drop off in quality.    I guess we will try some other restaurants in the future for our special occasions.

I'm not exactly sure why this place was so highly rated. When I made reservations I let them know it was our anniversary. When we arrived they let us know that a private party was planned for that night. We were stuck in a cubby hole like space next to two other groups and it was very crammed and uncomfortable, very irritating and non-romantic. The place is small as it is. We ordered the dates, caesar salad, salmon and mussels. The dates were good but over the top rich, caesar was swimming in dressing and hard to eat because too much dressing, the mussels were cooked well but the broth was bad. It tasted like straight up white wine and was very under seasoned. The salmon was also cooked well but also under seasoned and nothing special. The truffle fries that came with mussels were amazing. So french fries were the highlight of the meal. I won't recommend this place to anybody and won't be back. Anniversary fail.

I would visit simply for the pre-fix night. Great north side establishment that provides a quaint atmosphere with chef-driven food along with BYOB. HB is definitely a spot where I'd be willing to be adventurous because I know the chef knows what he/she is doing and have confidence that the execution of the dish will be on point.

This is one of my favorite spots in the city.  The menu is eclectic and creative, and it's an excellent value.  Not to mention, it's BYOB.  The service is always friendly and helpful, and the restaurant is the perfect size.

I had the absolute worst experience here. NEVER EVER RETURNING. After reading all of the positive yelp reviews for this place I made a reservation for me and three friends not familiar with Chicago to eat here on Friday night. Deciding we were not that hungry we ordered 3 appetizers to split among the table. Our waiter was incredibly rude and made a remark about us only ordering appetizers. At 8:15 the manager came over and stated that since we did not order that much food they were going to need us to leave within 30 minuets. We had just opened our bottles of wine as it is a BYOB restaurant, they rushed out our appetizers and brought the check at the same time they brought out our food. 10 minuets after our food came they tried to take our plates away before we were even done eating and asked us to please hurry. The experience was BIZARRE. Still in shock by the rudeness I experienced at this restaurant. I would not recommend this place to anyone.

Its hard to even make up something bad about Home Bistro.  I think just about everything about it is great from the delicious, handmade dishes to the BYOB policy.  This place is quite small, but they were easily able to accommodate a group of 6 of us on a Saturday evening.   The menu is not big, so between 6 people and 2 apps, we were able to see a really big sample of everything HB has to offer.  Every. Single. Dish. looked amazing.  The general consensus at my table was that everyone was jealous they didn't order the mussels entree.  It is a massive bowl of mussels that comes with an equally massive bowl of fries and handmade aioli sauce.  In reality, no one was disappointed with their dish, and everyone agreed they would be back to try something different. For appetizers we got the escargot and patatas bravas.  The escargot, while delicious, turned out to not be a great option for sharing, and the patatas bravas turned out to be both delicious and great for a group of 6.  I will say the food takes some time.  I didn't really mind because the quality is worth the wait, and there is probably a very small kitchen/staff.  I cant recommend this place enough, and its even easy to make reservations right on their website.

This restaurant has delicious food. We went there last night. My friend had the roast loin of pork topped with fresh cherries from Door County. My husband had gnocchi stuffed with cheese and I had a meatball dish with polenta. The service was excellent. The restaurant is in a convenient Lakeview location.
The food was flavorful. The menu diverse. The service was prompt and helpful. The view was perfect. Highly recommend.

Their roasted pork shoulder with creamed corn and Chinese broccoli was fantastic. The pork shoulder was the best I have ever had. And BYOB makes it easy to have fabulous meal and a good price. Will definitely be coming back.

third time here and HB NEVER disappoints me. The mussel, clam, scallop and crisp crab dish is as amazing as a shell fish dish gets. Crispy pork belly is innovative, that is a high praise from a Chinese who literally ate every possible part of a pig in every possible way. Sipcy chocolate bar is another surprise.

This place is great. They've got an inventive menu that they change up ever few months and the BYOB factor keeps the bill down. Everything is always fresh and high quality. Never been disappointed after a visit.

Full disclosure. My cousin works here. He is an amazing chef and awesome person, but this review is not about him (well, kind of is, but stick with me), it's about the food and ambiance. Mm-mm the food. Yay the ambiance.  I had just moved to Chicago from LA. I took a trip to HB and dined on a multi-course meal of sheer deliciousness. I begged my cousin for every recipe, but he couldn't share secrets obviously, so I have resided to return over and over and over and over again, until I'm dead and buried (or cremated, jury's out). HB is small but in a warm and welcoming sort of way. The exposed brick and lighting make you feel like you're at a friend's house with more of your friends and some of their friends. The staff is amazing and friendly, like they're your friends. This place just makes me think of friends. It's a good friend of mine. Good friend. I really love it because you can have conversations with people and not feel like you have to yell. It's not overly quiet. It's the perfect mix of peace and energy.  I'm so proud of my talented cousin following his dream. To think of him doing anything else brings tears to my eyes, but in the SELFISH sort of way because... delicious food. Without him, where would I eat? Oh, I could try and try and die trying to find an HB taste-alike, but it'd never truly be HB. Never. Can't wait until next time. I'm coming for you cuz (and the food - mostly the food. Sorry, not sorry). I'm expanding my belly first, too, so stock those fridges.

WOW. This was some of the best food I have ever had. Since it was a Wednesday, they had a fixed menu option, three courses for $35. We weren't planning on getting that much food but it was totally worth it.  The escargot and bacon wrapped dates were incredible. Both salads were great, and our entrees were amazing. They even brought a complimentary bread pudding for me since it was my birthday.  The service was excellent, our server was super helpful since we couldn't decide what to order (everything sounds delicious). She even brought other orders past to show us as we were deciding. I highly recommend this restaurant.
I had a great experience!!  we had trout and the smoked chicken and it was amazing the beet salad with pistachio butter was incredible!!  service was phenomenal thank you again see you guys soon!!

Yelping for the best BYOB place in the city, I found home bistro had very nice reviews and stars. I wanna to have a very small/intimate dinner party for my wedding and searching and reading I decided this was the place I wanna to do it.  I passed by this restaurant but never had the chance to go inside. When I walked in for my surprise my friends got there before me and decorated the spot the owner or manager reserved for us.  The attention since we got there was amazing, the area we got couldn't be more perfect for the occasion and Intimate the way I wanted. My friend brought a lot of booze to celebrate my wedding, definitely was A+ you could bring your own champagne and wine to celebrate since as you know this couldn't be very expensive in other places.  We ordered the food and everything was so delicious and well done. Since we were a party of 10 we had to choose one of their group deal, which it was good amount of food and came pretty fast. I which I couldn't remember what we ordered to recommend here but unfortunately I can't. Only I do remember was a beef hash or something that I couldn't stop saying how AMAZING was that plate.   I agree with all the people with positive reviews about this restaurant, it's a great spot in boystown.

GREAT date night spot. Booked an 8:30 reservation on a Friday and was seated immediately at the last available table- this place knows how to run a tight ship! (When seated they let us know we should order apps/entrees together in order to keep everything expedited). Service was great- I loved our waitress who provided honest feedback about all dishes I asked questions about, and ambiance was super cute (BYOB also, how can you go wrong?)! Food Breakdown: Artichoke & Edam Fritters - Fav dish of the night. These were bursting with flavor. Would order them again in a heartbeat. Asparagus w/ Fried Egg - This was on the specials. It was good, but the artichoke was definitely better.  Buttermilk Fried Smoked Chicken Sandwich - Came w/ fries which were fine- nothing to write home about, but the sandwich was fantastic (and had come as a recommendation from the table next to us!) Sockeye Salmon- I don't know what was on this salmon but it was perfect. The marinade was delicious, it was cooked perfectly! It came with a quinoa side dish which I didn't love. The flavors were a bit sharp and tangy, but the ingredients were very fresh. (The salmon was so good I`d still order it again despite not loving the side) Located smackdab in the middle of boystown, not too many bars nearby to go to after if you're on a date- but still definitely worth it!

After all the great things we've heard about HB from our friends and neighbors we finally made it. We feel bad writing this but feel as though we must. We ordered 4 dishes 1. Veal sweetbread 2. Artichoke and Edam fritters 3. Pork chop special and 4. Homemade Fettuccine. We did order on Friday night before the kitchen closed bc it was a long day at work, but still wanted a great date night dinner. All 4 dishes were less than subpar and overtly salty. When we read a previous post about a guests salty dish, I knew it wasnt just ours for arriving before close. We spent  $100.00 and left with belly aches and dissatisfaction. The service from Amy was pleasant and she was super sweet, I just wish for that amount the food that drove us to come here was as good. My husband can eat anything and not complain, yet this was a first and out first experience here.

Home Bistro was, as the three stars indicate, A-OK.  The ambiance was intimate and nice, and the service was kind.  The fact that it's BYOB is a huge plus, too.  In terms of the food, I was underwhelmed with my $24 Handcut Fettucinni; it was fine but nothing amazing, especially for the price.  My friends enjoyed their Amsterdam Style Mussels (huge portion!) and Pan-Fried Skirt Steak.  Overall, I wouldn't rush back here, but I would maybe recommend it for someone who is in the neighborhood and looking for a nice casual place for a date or to catch up with a friend.

We decided to go to Home Bistro for someone's birthday.  Appetizers were great.  We had the mussels which came with truffle fries.  Wish i knew it beforehand because that probably would have changed my main dish choice. We also had the daily bread which was really tasty.  I was not really thrilled with my lamb burger.  I mean it was over $20 and i expected something little better.  They also do not comp their dessert for birthdays.  I mean when you charge $20 for a simple burger, the least you can do is comp a silly little cake with a candle.  All in all, the experience was good.  Also, it is ByOB.

Cute little restaurant situated in Boystown that serves up rich, delicious food. I had the ricotta gnocchi with duck meatballs--- some of the best gnocchi I've ever had, with a great bechemel sauce. The crispy oysters with polenta was good, but the oysters were more fried batter than oyster--- but what else can I expect for seafood in the midwest. Service was decent. Overall a good spot to check out.

Order: Duck Meatballs. BYOB!! (. :). ) The meat balls was amazing. I have never eaten duck and I must say I might have to try and eat these cute little guys again.  I honestly felt guilty eating duck.... BUT! It was worth every bite...   :0
I love this place. The food is very good, albeit a bit heavy, and the ambiance is cozy. We love coming here!

Cozy restaurant close to our airbnb home. Broccoli salad: 4 stars.  Fresh and not drowning in dressing Bacon wrapped dates:  3 stars.   Nice balance of sweet and salty Chicken livers:  2 stars.  Turns out I don't like liver after all.  Nice presentation. Homemade fettuccine with octopus:  3 stars.  Too heavy on the olive oil.  Could improve on the pasta texture - not quite succulent enough.   Octopus itself was tender and not fishy.    Trout:  4 stars.  Delicious Pork shank:  5 stars.  WOW!  Fall off the bone, tender, flavorful and perfect with  the pickled cabbage and mashed sweet potato.

Great place. Ashamed to admit we come here at least twice a month- it's that good. Food is excellent- portions are quite large, and you won't be disappointed. Love their salmon as well as the patatas bravas. Have not had a single dish here that was anything less than delicious. You should come here for both brunch and dinner- creative and amazing. Servers are sweethearts and quite attentive, but also mindful about letting you enjoy your meal. The older gentleman who busses tables during their dinner shifts is highly efficient and quick at removing plates. Place is small so occasionally you need to wait to be seated but it's worth it.

Food was good, but the service seemed overwhelmed. I had a reservation for 2 on a weekend night, and had to wait 20min after our reservation to sit. Our waiter opened our wine that we had brought, but we had to wait ~10min to have wine glasses brought to us because they had run out and had to get some cleaned. I ordered the special (which sounded amazing) but was told that they had already run out. This is fine, but the waiter had given us the details about the special 5min before... so I was disappointed in my unfortunate timing. Finally, our appetizer was given to us with-out plates, and the waiter was busy with other tables, so we flag the bus-boy to ask for him to bring us some plates. Besides this, I will say the food was delicious and the environment was friendly and relaxed. I would guess my problems with the service we unlucky being that it was a busy weekend night and we were also told it was the first night of a new menu.

The food, service, and atmosphere here is amazing. I have to say, they had one of the best salmon fillets I've had since moving here. Also, our waitress, who I believe had the entire place was friendly and extremely informative and helpful. Also, it's BYOB so be sure to bring some vino!

My wife and I visited this fun place Saturday night. We were the guests of another couple. The restaurant was packed and for good reason. The food is wonderful, full of flavor, but not pretentious. It is BYOB but we had 2 great bottles with us. Service is good, staff might be a tad overwhelmed. A nice night out and for sure I will return.

I had a nice dinner here last night!  Dave was our waiter, who was friendly and attentive.  I started with sharing the sweetbread appetizer with arugula and a nice aioli.  I also shared the escargot with cherry tomatoes, butter, shallots, garlic and seasonings with white wine reduction, yummy!  I had the trout with fingerling potatoes and I don't even remember what else, just that it was very good!  I got side tracked, as I was excited about being able to BYOB of wine.   Make reservations, as it's a very small venue and seats fill up fast.  We went around 8:45 pm calling only a half hour ahead on a Friday night.  They did seat us fairly quickly. We weren't rushed and were able to enjoy our conversation without being pressured.   I enjoyed our evening and will be back!

Wonderful food, everyone I dined with said it was one of their favorite meals in Chicago. Creative (but not TOO creative) dishes, well-prepared, with a surprise flavor palate if you look for it (toasted brown sugar on the dates, anise in the mussels were particularly interesting). Solid. Normally, this would get a restaurant a 4-star rating. However, the setup of HB is what put it over the top. Unpretentious and relaxed, it was a nice respite from the Fulton Market standard. BYOB is a plus. Service was hands-off, but there when you needed it. Pluses all around.

Shared the muscles and frites and the curry pork shoulder. The muscles were delicious but a little anise-heavy. The fries prepared to perfection! The curry pork shoulder was outstanding - the curry sauce had clear, delightful notes of coconut and peanuts with a bit of spice. The pork shoulder was incredibly tender went perfectly with the sauce - not to mention the jasmine rice 'salad' (which was just flavored cold rice, but fantastic flavored cold rice at that). Somebody else in my party had the smoked amish chicken thighs which were cooked to perfection. For desert we had the bread pudding served with (what seemed like) fresh whipped cream and a vanilla icing. The bread pudding was the perfect texture and a large portion at that!

We had an excellent meal here:  beet salad with goat cheese balls rolled in crushed pistachios, salmon with quinoa, and a dish made with Israeli couscous and fresh cranberries.  Dessert was pumpkin fritters with a salted caramel sauce.  Everything was perfectly prepared and nicely presented.  The service was attentive and unpretentious.  We will recommend this place to anyone like us travelling to Chicago, especially if they are hanging out in Boystown.

My boyfriend and I came here to celebrate a promotion, and it didn't disappoint. The place is pretty small, so we had to call ahead and make reservations for sure. We went on a Friday night, and it was packed. For a quality restaurant like this, it is SO NICE that it is BYOB. Normally, you spend a ton of money on food, then buy super pricey drinks and wine. Not here.  I would say the staff as a whole wasn't very friendly, but they were fine overall. The menu isn't huge either, but you can kind of expect that when the menu changes as much as this one does. All of the menu items were different and made to perfection. We would go again once the menu changes to try more of their original recipes.

Worst experience I have had at a restaurant in Chicago in 25 years. Told by manager/owner with a flustered face and voice to leave the restaurant "right now" because "Your time is up. I have others waiting for a table." My friend and I were there for 2 hours and 10 minutes, with a reservation. The demand killed the evening and our appetites (we still had food on our plates). Clearly, the management poorly manages scheduling and flow of diners (overbooking). I have never been timed at a full-service restaurant. If I knew we would be booted out into the snow in 2 hours or less, I would never have made a reservation at this restaurant, and I never will return nor will my friend. HIGHLY DISRECOMMEND.

We decided to come here on a double date with some friends. It was a great experience to begin with and the food was good.  Half way into our appetizers a homeless man walked in and stumbled upon our table spilling food onto myself before falling onto the floor. Being there is no host/hostess, the staff was all in the back and saw non of it. Thankfully another patron at the table next to us escorted him out. I feel bad for the man was homeless, but you don't expect it. The bust boy approached with some extra towels, but notified no one that someone was just picked up off the floor. When I approached the waiter or who seemed to be the owner I explained to him what happened and he seemed like it was the first time this had happened, although you could tell through his attitude it was not. He offered no apology and with an attitude offered for me to bring back my dry cleaning bill.  It was an overall uncomfortable experience.

Having read up on HB, I gave this as an option to my husband for planning our anniversary dinner. We are both happy he chose it. I do not typically like short menus....this girl likes options. However, someone in an earlier review mentioned preferring a few dishes to choose from because you know they are taking care of each dish, as opposed to mass producing for 40 different options. YES!!! That is exactly what you get out of Home Bistro.  For you foodies out there (or those of you striving to be, like me), you need to come here. Do your homework and check out the menu online, periodically - they do change things up. It is a small, intimate setting. We were the first reservation of the evening (Thursday), but within half an hour, most of the tables were taken. I loved the vibe....the young hipster crowd, Gen Xers like us, people my parents' age....everyone brought their bottles, cracked them open, and took in the experience.  My husband had never had escargot, and he was willing to try the appetizer. It had us at hello...escargot, sauteed garlic with roasted tomatoes...the garlic clove just melted - at first, I was put off by a whole clove, but it is obvious it was cooked in the buttery sauce, and it was not garlicky...just ridiculously delicious! When they first served it I was like where's the bread - not necessary! They could probably use a couple of more croutons to help soak up the sauce, but we made sure we did not leave a speck in the bowl.  We then ordered the endive salad...the flavors were subtle...almost a bit too subtle because it was more dry than I would've preferred - just a tad more of the walnut dressing would've knocked it out of the park. Then, my husband ordered the Bulgogi Steak w/truffle fries...it was surprisingly served as a sandwich, NOT what we expected but SO happy with it. My husband asked for ketchup, and I thought the owner (who was helping serve our table) was going to have a grabber by the look on his face, but we didn't see that they had placed the cup with the truffle mayo on the table...oh man, probably the best truffle ANYTHING I've ever had - you have to be so careful with adding Truffle Oil to anything because it can be overpowering but this was subtlety at it's finest!  I had one of the evening's specials, homemade pappardelle in a cherry pepper arrabiatta sauce...how can sauce first taste too sweet, then too spicy, then just blend together to be so absolutely right?! So good! I'm not a huge fan of paying $25 for a bowl of pasta (or for a sandwich, which is why I took a star away - the food is a bit overpriced), especially one that doesn't include some sort of meat or fish, but I loved it! My husband and I both agreed it was close to as perfectly al dente as you are going to get. At first, we thought the portions of our meals looked small, as some previous reviewers mentioned, but we took a lot of time with each course, tasting and observing what was on the plate, so it made it a truly enjoyable experience for our palets. And, it is what I love about this place - unique flavors you really won't have anywhere else. It's exactly the type of dining experience my husband and I prefer - something that is not cookie-cutter and has its own personality....GREAT EXPERIENCE!  The owner overheard us toasting our anniversary, and brought dessert on the house....after The Ketchup Incident, we were pleasantly surprised. We had ordered the Ras el Hanout Panna Cotta. He recommended it, as it is homemade, and he said it would pair nicely with our bubbly. I don't even know how to describe the flavors....I tasted basil, lime, a sweetness I couldn't identify (thanks byob,  by then i was a wee bit sauced). WHATEVER it was, it was so delicious, refreshing and indulgent at the same time. Not Alinea-level fine dining obviously, but a pleasurable, down-to-earth, unique experience.

I went with my wife a couple of weeks ago and here is my experience!!! We had been wanting to go this place for a long time. I read the reviews and the pics in Yelp and they looked amazing.  To be honest, the food did not meet our expectations. We had the dates with brown sugar- they were good. Then the fried oyster tacos and unfortunately the tortilla was falling apart. Not sure if it was because of the brand or because they were kinda cold. Then, our waiter recommended the Osbuco and the fall gnocchi dish so of course we went for it. The Osobuco wasn't tender and for the same reason it did not have a lot of flavor. It came with greens in the side and they were so bitter that we weren't able to eat them. The gnocchis were ok. Not a big fan of the combination but they were well prepared. For dessert we had the pudding and that one was good. The service was good. All my comments are regarding the food. We decided to send an email to the chef/owner of the restaurant and he did response with a thanks message for the feedback and an apologize for the experience.
Exceptional good food and service.  Wonderful combination of home style cooking with high end chef.  Great service.  The menu changes frequently to reflect seasonal food varieties.  Eat here!

This food is inspired and delicious. BYOB. There is a 711 for beer across the street. We didn't have a reservation and the girl accommodated us anyway, squeezed us in. She actually encouraged me to run across the street and grab some beers if you want so that being said its a clean place but not snobby. One of the best meals I've had period. I had the Amish chicken. Being that our bill had no drinks and just 2 entrees we stayed around 50 bucks and left full and happy.

Decided to here on a whim when I saw they had a prix fix menu. Definitely do not regret it - everything we had was delicious, and everything on their menu is available for the meal. The favorite was the mussels and chorizo dinner - the special of the day. It was a huge plate of mussels and a few clams with a chorizo sauce at the bottom. Definitely recommend if they have it when you are there. Also BYOB with no corkage fee.

I've been here many many times, only once did I leave disappointed but must've been a fluke, cause I've been there many times afterward and still love it!  Great food, great ambiance and it's BYOB. I've been there for intimate dinner with friends and as a large group. For the group dinners we've been able to arrange family style ordering at a pp rate. Also on Wednesdays they offer a prix fixe menu. I highly recommend this place.

You cannot go wrong with anything you order from here. They don't have many choices on the menu, which tells me that they actually put a lot of effort into making 10 dishes phenomenally rather than 40 dishes just mediocre. The dishes have very unique pairings of ingredients that I've never seen anywhere else. The place is very cozy and classy. It's perfect for a date night, especially if you're looking to leisurely talk for a while and drink. It's BYOB, so bring some wine, but save some to pair with the bread pudding at the end ;)

Made a same-day reservation for 8. Service was great! Very friendly. Dishes were amazing!! Had escargot for the first time, WONDERFUL! The fritters were pretty delicious; both appetizer and dessert. Prices were perfect, very affordable. Thanks for making us feel comfortable enough to ''get loud'' with old & new friends.

We did not have a very good experience here on Saturday night. My friend from NYC picked this place out due to its location and the great reviews. I brought the wine.  Its cute and has a small dining area, but its also very loud. It looks like it would be a great date night place but maybe not for the first date because you have to scream to be heard. We started with the fried zucchini that came with a soft boiled egg. It was really good. The zucchini wasn't soggy, it had good seasoning. We were excited for the good start. Then we waited. And waited. And waited...they didn't seem to notice that we waited a really long time for 2 entrees that shouldn't take very long. Then they brought my friend's chicken thighs. And we sat and looked at each other for a bit....then he waived down one of the guys and asked where my dinner was. A min later he brought it out but didn't break his stride. No apology, no explanation of what we were about to eat. Nothing. Our initial reaction for both dishes that they didn't look great. I had four little scallops sitting next to some carrots and two slices of parsnips. It was sitting on dry wild rice. The scallops were so incredibly salty that I couldn't eat them. Dry rice is also not a joy to eat. So I had some carrots. My friend thought they were stingy with the chicken thighs. He received two and a bunch of brussels sprouts to fill up the plate. His chicken was also too salty to eat.  Then the bus boy took our plates away. No one took notice that they were full plates! No one asked how our meal was, or questioned why we were pretty much sending the whole thing back. Then after another glass of wine one of the waiters came over and asked if we wanted dessert.  We did not. They didn't seem to care.

What a gem of a neighbor hood restaurant.  My friend and I got in on a busy evening.  The staff was accommodating and friendly.  It is BYOB; we would have preferred alcohol but the food didn't need it.  a varied selection with a vegetarian option as well.  Try the scallops.  It was a delicious combo with the corn chowder.  Real corn off the cob!  A tad noisy but that's what we love about holes in the wall with good food.

I wanted to love this place... but this was a below average experience.   First the pros:  The restaurant itself is intimate and unpretentious, and is located in a lively part of the city.  The menu hit all the right notes for me and I struggled to choose from three or four different entrees (a good problem!).  Finally,  the BYOB policy makes the bottom line very reasonable. I dined with a group that likes to taste and share, so we collectively ordered the corn-off-the-cob , shishito peppers, bacon wrapped dates, and endive salad appetizers, and the "Amsterdam style" mussels, seared scallops, and the pork shoulder and mussels/clams in white wine special.  The dishes were all nicely cooked and nothing was downright offensive (outside of the scallops and mussels/clams special, both of which were aggressively salty), but were underwhelming in terms of flavor and overall harmony.  The highlight of the meal was the pork shoulder, which melted in your mouth.  I also enjoyed the shishito peppers, truffle fries and the bacon-wrapped dates, although not enough to save the meal for me.  I actually wanted to give 2 stars based on the service, but it didn't seem fair to downgrade the entire restaurant on the basis of one server.   Perhaps we just came on an off-night, but HB just missed the mark  for me...

Went on a beautiful Saturday night for a date! It is a nice place, cute inside, nice decor. A bit loud, but overall very pleasant. Food was hit or miss: the escargot appetizer was amazing. The Fettuchine and Muscles for main dish were good, but not anything I would consider ordering again. Did not get a chance to try the desert manu. BYOB is a big plus. Service was very nice. Overall, 4 stars. Would definitely come back and try other dishes.
Very good food and a nice, comfortable atmosphere. The food was very delicious and the server was incredibly knowledgeable and friendly.

BYOB'd on Easter Sunday. Does that make me a sinner? I came with a fun brunch group that entailed one friend who had given up alcohol for lent. Easter Sunday he proclaimed, "Jesus rose and so will my liver!"  HB was the spot for this. The space isn't very large but it's airy and quaint. The bathroom is labeled as a study or something like that, and it feels like it's antique. There's only one toilet, so don't break the seal until you really need to. The server was slightly overwhelmed and kept bringing out individual food items instead of everything all at once and forgot side item requests. Jesus forgives, so can I.  We popped champagne, bailey's with coffee, I think some vodka too. The drinks made the so/so service much easier to handle as the waitress went a little MIA when it was time to pay the bills.  As for food, the french pudding French toast is where it's at. Veggie pancake was unique and I didn't feel like I was going to get bloated from eating this, but not sure I'd get it again. Felt like it needed different seasonings. Hubby loved his breakfast burger and everyone was pretty content with their meals.  All in all, I would hit up HB for brunch or anything else again as BYOBing makes anything mediocre, holy.

We stopped in for dessert and had the bread pudding. It was served differently from any bread pudding I've seen before. It came as slices, rather than in a ramekin or other container. It was delicious, though. Service was also extremely friendly and stopped and chatted with us for a while about the BYOB laws in Chicago (HB is BYOB). Have not eaten a full meal there yet, but definitely will be coming back.

My friend and I were visiting Chicago for a few days and decided to look for a place to eat when we got there. This place had great reviews on Yelp but said reservations suggested. We walked in and the hostess was nice and found a table for us, it's a small place and was packed not long after we sat. We ordered the deep fried Asparagus as suggested on Yelp and we were not dissappointed, We then ordered the lamb and watermelon and the chicken sausage. the Chicken sausage was good, not great. the Lamb was braised perfectly and the combo with watermelon and feta was perfect. The problem is the food portions are small and way over priced. The Lamb dish had cubed Lamb and had 4 or 5 cubes and a ton of watermelon for $30. not worth it. It was just a good place. Not great.

I don't have much to say about the restaurant. Go here if you want a great dinner with lots of interesting options. The restaurant is BYOB, staff is super friendly and the atmosphere is super laid back. Don't be surprised if you need to be a little louder as the space is quaint and gather sounds very quickly.

We love this place!  We have eaten here more times that we can count.  The food is creative and delicious.  The space is cozy and the service always attentive.  Being a BYOB is an extra plus.  Just fabulous!

I do not have a single bad word to say about Home Bistro. It is a charming little storefront that is easy to miss if you're not looking for it, but is absolutely worth your while. The host/waiter is incredibly friendly and helpful with any questions. The menu is incredibly diverse and intriguing. On my most recent visit, our waiter said they were out of the dates but those are the least exciting thing on the menu! I liked his joke and his honesty. Of all the things I've had: the escargot was absolutely to die for. Probably my favorite that I've ever had. The specials are always on point. I've had two specials that I wish were regular menu items. But that's the thing about Home Bistro, everything is so good and unique. I wouldn't hesitate to order a single thing. Plus BYOB is always great. I would give HB 100 stars and many return visits.

Made a reservation for a party of 6 on a Friday night and..... -We sat right down at our reserved time -Our waitress was awesome, especially with bringing us booze from our BYOB stash -Regarding the above, there was no corkage fee and we brought a lot to drink -The Shishito Peppers  were an excellent appetizer with a bit of a kick -They had a special crab sandwich on the menu the night we were there, it was delicious, though it got soggy by the time I finished the first half -The Truffle fries!!! Woah! Best thing I had the whole night. I am a sucker for fries though -I don't personally like bread pudding, but all other 5 people at the table raved about how good it was -The total bill for 5 apps, 6 entrees and 2 desserts was $220 which is VERY affordable Will definitely be back here again.

We had heard lots of great things so decided to check it our for ourselves ... and we're glad we did.  The chef does a great job of mixing flavors in each dish and if you get the right mix of dishes, you'll have a cornucopia of flavors through the evening.   Our favorites ... - Beer battered asparagus; enjoy the egg sauce and asparagus together for the best flavor combinations - Patatas bravas; we try this everywhere we see it on a menu - and this version is fantastic - Scallops; simply scrumptious full strong flavors in the kale compliment the scallops - Rainbow Trout; an incredibly complex mix of flavors, each bite is different from the last We happened to be celebrating a birthday so the server comp'd us an amazing panna cotta.  A hint of cardamon hides in each bite ... and lingers gently.  Really nice

Really incredible. cozy warm vibe with upbeat music so you won't fall asleep. Had the pork belly to start, was absolutely to die for. The waitress was friendly and laid back, pretty fun to engage with. Had a fried gnocchi dish and we also got the special fish stew.

Visiting Chicago from Los Angeles, and had a great meal here. I was still thinking about it the next day! I ordered a special, which was ricotta gnocchi with chicken, spinach, peppers, and blue cheese. It was amazing. I would definitely recommend this place and hope to go back.

I'm a little surprised I really hadn't heard much about HB since it's a tiny spot in Boystown that features a menu that isn't exactly out of the ordinary.  That's when I sat down and read the menu, and found this in the appetizer section: "Beer-Battered Asparagus" Home Bistro does comfort food right, and the asparagus was no exception.  First, the damn things were huge--and they were mounted on one side of a large plate with a dipping sauce that was basically mayo and horseradish and a big egg that you broke to mix in with the other sauce.  This worked well.  The rainbow trout was my selection of an entrée and that also worked to perfection, although I would admit "perfection" included salted flesh, near-perfect potatoes and pickled red cabbage, which isn't something I look for typically.  My wife grabbed the mussels, mainly because she ALWAYS gets mussels if they are on the menu...the gobbling sounds of delight from across the table told me all I needed to know there, although the fries were not much better than McDonald's with an aioli that wasn't memorable.  (Of course, we downed all of the fries and nearly all of the aioli anyway...but, still.) With tax and tip, we got out of this for $62.  How was that possible, with all of the entrees prices in the $20-and-up category?  BYO, my friends.  If you are gonna give me high-end food and the chance to bring my own wine, you and I will become very close, very quickly, so I have to give HB credit for making date night for the two of us so very worth it. A La Card steered me here so we got $10 off of our meal...grab that deck if you haven't already!

The only reason this restaurant is getting two stars instead of one is because of the pleasant atmosphere. Otherwise, I came with a party of 6 and no one, I repeat, no one liked their meal. Food was bland and unappetizing. At this price point we were all supremely disappointed. No thanks!

This place is pretty small and not eye-catching from outside. It's pretty dim and quite inside, which is good for a date dinner I feel. There are not overwhelming choices on the menu. We ordered fresh off the cod corn salad and red leaf lettuce salad! They taste pretty awesome except for they are a little bit too salty. But over all experience is positive in this restaurant:)

WOW!!! Best brunch I'be ever had. I had the Kimchee, my friends had the chorizo and the breakfast sandwich. I tasted all of them and there wasn't a bad choice among us. Chill vibe, friendly owners. Great Place!

Home Bistro serves 5-star food at a reasonable price. Taste-wise, this restaurant is probably among the best in Chicago. What's more, every Wednesday, you can get a 3 course meal for just $33 (a $50+ value)!  The interior design is very unique too. I would call it cozy but quirky. Unfortunately, the restaurant is a bit small. But the reason why Home Bistro doesn't get 5 stars is because of the service. I counted just one waiter, and if there were more waiters, it certainly feels like there's only one waiter. If service time were to improve with an additional waiter, then this would definitely be a solid restaurant.
This place is a gem. The staff is extremely friendly. The ambiance is great and so is the food! Make a reservation on their website for easy booking!

Bravo! Home Bistro has moved into my top 5 places for dinner in Chicago. On a whim we decided to make a reservation since we were heading to an event down the street. We were able to secure a same day booking, which was nice. The space is cozy and ideal for small groups (less than 4, but ideally 2). While you could bring a large group, the place itself only seats around 50, so be careful.   The menu is amazing. There were so many great options it was hard to choose what we wanted.In terms of our meal, we got he red leaf salad, fried oysters, Amsterdam muscles, and the pork shoulder steak special. The muscles came with a huge bowl of fries, which coincidentally went really well as an accompaniment to the pork shoulder steak. I had never seen pork shoulder (still with the bone) served like a steak, but I'd easily order it again. It was perfectly grilled with a creme fresh and strawberry compote on top. Very simple, yet highly flavorful.    It's BYOB, so plan accordingly. There is a 7-11 across the street if you wanted to pick up something. If you bring wine and need it chilled, they can bring a bucket out for you table side.  There were only 3-4 front of house staff working, but it was perfect because HB is so small. They were all highly friendly and made a point to explain the entire menu, and check on us frequently. The food came out promptly after ordering.  Again, great work, Home Bistro! We will be back for sure. We will for sure be back to try the items we didn't get to sample. To me, this is the sign of a great chef and menu planner. Just seeing all the great things on the menu will bring us back. They don't need to advertise or anything, just keep offering great food at a reasonable price.

Definitely a 5 star experience! Hubby says this was his best meal ever in Chicago! It was for sure right up there with some of the best I've ever had. From the moment we walked in and were greeted by the lovely smiling hostess, I was feeling this place. We had made a reso and arrived before our other friends, but they went ahead and seated us which we appreciated. We had brought two bottles of bubbly and opened one right away....why hold off the celebration?? Our server, Dionne, casually floated by, took the one bottle to keep cold and brought us an ice bucket for the open bottle. More to come about this amazing "floating Dionne" to come.... Our friends arrived, with another 2 bottles of wine. We don't play. Anyway, Dionne came right over and took care of them as well...opened their one bottle and poured a couple of glasses for them. She then floated off to give us time to chit chat and settle in. In a few minutes, she returned, sat down next to me on the bench and proceeded to share the specials. We loved that Dionne felt comfortable enough to cozy up to us in this way. We are a pretty open and fun group, so it felt completely natural to have her on our level and just being real and down to earth in the moment. So for starters we had the fried oysters, patatas bravas and the artichoke appetizer. Where do I begin??? The detailed preparation, mix of fresh flavors and presentation were beyond impressive! I can't even begin to explain the explosion of savory delight that occurred upon each and every bite of literally every dish. Unbelievable! I'm so serious! For entrees the two guys got the buttermilk fried smoke chicken sandwich, with slaw and pickles. Ridiculous.....ohhhhheeemmmmmgggeeeeee they were like, "this is the best sandwich I've ever eaten!" And, for certain it was. The sandwich came with truffle fries. Now, I'm obsessed with truffle fries and these were hands down THE BEST truffles fries that have touched this mouth. Hubs was like, these fries are kinda white looking, so Dionne told him to try one to make sure they were done. He tried one and was floored with delight. They were perfect. So, get this, as we were going hard on our food and having great conversation, Dionne "floated" by again, slid between our friends and swiped a fry off my husbands plate! Lol it happened so fast and we were all like, did that just happen?!? We totally lost our shit and were laughing hysterically as Dionne stood back and winked! She became my hero at that moment. I realize a server can't get away with that kinda stunt with most people, but that she could read our vibe and have fun with us, made the experience one of my favorites ever! I got the soft shell crab special....deliciousness. I'm an east coast girl originally so I could def appreciate this wonderful dish. My gf had the vegetarian dish with spatzel and cheese. It was also a delight. Dessert was next. Oh my oh my. We couldn't decide on one to share so we got all three. The panda cotta with lemon zest, pepper and salt. Sounds weird but was our fave. The bread pudding was incredible and the dark chocolate with walnuts and dried fruit was spectacular.  We will def be back...and often!!

The main takeaway: excruciatingly slow service.  They have only one server + one water filler/greeter. The restaurant is not big, but the labor is clearly not enough.  The appetizer came fairly quickly, but 40 minutes after we finish the appetizer, the entrees are not coming for a table of TWO....by that time, we have finished eating the Hershey's kisses I could find in my purse (reserved for my toddler's emergencies). It is getting ridiculous feeling the table so empty for so long.  Other tables around us are also helplessly waiting. They didn't even have bread to help you to get over these long waits, which I expect from this not too modestly priced restaurant.  Finally, I got the server's attention and asked him to check the progress of our dish. He came back saying the chef needs another 5 minutes because the duck breast my husband ordered takes a LONG time to prepare. (I was thinking: gosh, just bring it, we can eat it medium rare.) When the duck breast finally came: it is medium rare. It is pan-seared and it is rare!!!! It is obvious that this dish takes 5 minutes to prepare. Okay, why the server was not honest with us: sorry, the chef is so overwhelmed that he or she has forgotten to prepare your dish in the last 50 minutes!! We are not dumb! The food is fine.  I ordered mussel with fries.
